messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Sandra Dodd's column no longer in HEM
messages.msgSnippet: Oh yes!! Thank you for mentioning that one too Kelli. I have really enjoyed the two copies of Life Learning I ve had. I need to subscribe to that one..it s
messages.messageBody:
Oh yes!! Thank you for mentioning that one too Kelli. I have really enjoyed the two copies of Life Learning I've had. I need to subscribe to that one..it's good.
Ren

****

I subscribed to Life Learning in March, and I love it! So much better than HEM, not just in the unschooling sense, but in its support for gentle parenting as well.

The only recent article I wasn't crazy about was the one where the editor recommended limiting computer for kids. It was very refreshing to see her re-think her position after hearing from readers!

Syl

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Sandra Dodd's column no longer in HEM
messages.msgSnippet: As far as I m concerned, HEM was never an unschooling magazine...but at least it had an unschooling columnist with occasional unschooling articles thrown in.
messages.messageBody:
As far as I'm concerned, HEM was never an unschooling magazine...but at least it had an unschooling columnist with occasional unschooling articles thrown in.
Now there's NO reason for me to subscribe. I'm cancelling tomorrow.

I suggest the new "Live Free, Learn Free" for unschooling articles and support.

Ren

*****

I wrote cancelling mine today -- even asked for a refund, since I just subbed for 2yrs in March. I don't want their mag in my house thru Feb '06. I can read it for free at my favorite bookstore, if I happen to see anything interesting. I wonder if I could convince that bookstore to sell either of the other two?

Syl

messages.subject: Sandra Dodd's column no longer in HEM
messages.msgSnippet: I ll be checking out Life Learning Magazine Oh yes!! Thank you for mentioning that one too Kelli. I have really enjoyed the two copies of Life Learning I ve
messages.messageBody:
"I'll be checking out Life Learning Magazine"

Oh yes!! Thank you for mentioning that one too Kelli. I have really
enjoyed the two copies of Life Learning I've had. I need to
subscribe to that one..it's good. Very geared for
unschoolers/autodidacts of all ages. More along the lines of GWS.

Ren

messages.subject: Sandra Dodd's column no longer in HEM
messages.msgSnippet: Why? And what is left in the magazine for unschoolers? I see basically nothing left. As far as I m concerned, HEM was never an unschooling magazine...but at
messages.messageBody:
"Why? And what is left in the magazine for unschoolers? I see
basically nothing
left."

As far as I'm concerned, HEM was never an unschooling magazine...but
at least it had an unschooling columnist with occasional unschooling
articles thrown in.
Now there's NO reason for me to subscribe. I'm cancelling tomorrow.

I suggest the new "Live Free, Learn Free" for unschooling articles
and support.

Ren
